citation.article-title: Acetomicrobium flavidum, gen. nov., sp. nov., a thermophilic, anaerobic bacterium from sewage sludge, forming acetate, CO2 and H2 from glucose.

p.s: Description of Acetomicrobium flavidum sp. nov.
Acetomicrobium flavidum (Fla'vi.dum. L. adj. flavidus yellowish)
The general characteristics are as described for the genus.
Colonies on RCA agar plates 3-4 mm, convex, smooth, yellowish, circular, with entire margin.
Glucose, fructose, maltose, cellobiose, glycerol, casein and starch are fermented.

Sucrose, melibiose, mannose, ribose, arabinose, xylose, sorbitol, mannitol, gelatin, casamino acids, pyruvate, lactate, succinate, fumarate or malate are not fermented and do not increase growth, G + C content of DNA is 47.1%.
Isolated from a thermophile (60°C) sewage sludge fermentor.
